FuncDef:
The mpls te physical-interface bandwidth-auto-config disable command disables automatic bandwidth configuration on physical interfaces.
The undo mpls te physical-interface bandwidth-auto-config disable command enables automatic bandwidth configuration on physical interfaces.
This command varies in transport and router modes. For detailed differences, see Differences Between Commands in Transport and Router Modes. This topic describes the command configuration in router mode.
By default, automatic bandwidth configuration on physical interfaces is enabled.
CLIs: undo mpls te physical-interface bandwidth-auto-config disable
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
In transport mode, to disable automatic bandwidth configuration is enabled by default on a physical interface. Without this function enabled, after an NMS device the TE bandwidth of 0 kbit/s to a physical interface, the device uses the delivered bandwidth, not the actual bandwidth.
The mpls te physical-interface bandwidth-auto-config disable command is supported only in transport mode.
Prerequisites
MPLS TE has been globally enabled using the mpls te command in the MPLS view.
